paper_title: Whole genome sequencing, Coming of age: ten years of next-generation sequencing technologies, GATK website, McKenna et al. 2010 Genome Research (GATK framework paper), DePristo et al. 2011 Nature Genetics (GATK best practices 1.x and 2.x paper), Van der Auwera et al. 2013 Current Protocols In Bioinformatics (GATK Best Practices for Variant Discovery v2.x)
notes: A sequencing method for obtaining whole-genome DNA sequences; typically uses short reads and relies on having a reference genome. Different sequencing methods include chain termination sequencing (sanger), sequencing by synthesis, sequencing by ligation, single-molecule real-time sequencing, and Nanopore sequencing, etc.. The figure below shows the steps of sequencing by synthesis.

paper_title: In vitro, long-range sequence information for de novo genome assembly via transposase contiguity.,Haplotype-resolved whole-genome sequencing by contiguity-preserving transposition and combinatorial indexing.,Haplotype-resolved genome sequencing: experimental methods and applications.
notes: An experimental approach for genome-wide haplotyping based on contiguity-preserving transposition (CPT-seq) and combinatorial indexing.

paper_title: Illumina's Nextera DNA library preparation kit
notes: A DNA library preparation kit.

paper_title: Targeted capture and massively parallel sequencing of 12 human exomes, Exome Sequencing: Current and Future Perspectives
notes: A targeted sequencing method for obtaining exonic sequences; can be used to detect exonic mutations; especially suitable for studying Mendelian diseases.

paper_title: Genome-wide mapping of in vivo protein-DNA interactions.
notes: A sequencing method for mapping the locations of chosen DNA-binding proteins, such as transcription factors (TFs) and histones with epigenetic modifications.

seq_fullname: Chromatin ImmunoPrecipitation with lambda exonuclease digestion followed by high-throughput sequencing
seq_fullname_old: chromatin immunoprecipitation (ChIP) with lambda exonuclease digestion (exo) followed by high-throughput sequencing
paper_title: Comprehensive genome-wide protein-DNA interactions detected at single-nucleotide resolution.
notes: A variation of ChIP-seq, using an exonuclease to increase the resolution of protein binding site identification; can reach single basepair accuracy.

seq_fullname_old: ultra-low-input micrococcal nuclease-based native ChIP and sequencing
paper_title: An ultra-low-input native ChIP-seq protocol for genome-wide profiling of rare cell populations.
notes: A variation of ChIP-seq requiring as few as ~1000 cells to measure transcription binding sites.

paper_title: reChIP-seq reveals widespread bivalency of H3K4me3 and H3K27me3 in CD4(+) memory T cells.
notes: A method for detecting the co-localization of two proteins or patterns, such as transcription facors or epigenetic modifications. The original paper measured the co-localization of H3K4me3 and H3K27me3 in bivalently modified nucleosomes.

paper_title: CETCh-seq: CRISPR epitope tagging ChIP-seq of DNA-binding proteins
notes: Uses CRISPR/cas9 to engineer transcription factors (especially those lacking good antibodies), followed by ChIP-seq.

seq_fullname_old: selective microfluidics-based ligand enrichment followed by sequencing
paper_title: SMiLE-seq identifies binding motifs of single and dimeric transcription factors.
notes: Uses a semiautomated microfluidic platform to characterize transcription factor binding affinities.

paper_title: ChEC-seq kinetics discriminates transcription factor binding sites by DNA sequence and shape in vivo
notes: A method for measuring protein-DNA binding dynamics; fuses MNase with the protein of interest and uses calcium to control binding affinity and study binding dynamics.

paper_title: Ribose-seq: global mapping of ribonucleotides embedded in genomic DNA
notes: Maps the genome-wide locations of ribonucleotides that can be incorporated into DNA during eukaryotic DNA replication.

paper_title: Genome-wide analysis of human global and transcription-coupled excision repair of UV damage at single-nucleotide resolution
notes: Maps the locations of DNA excision caused by DNA repair.

paper_title: Genome-wide mapping of in vivo protein-DNA interactions.
notes: A widely used sequencing method for mapping the locations of DNA-binding components, such as transcription factors (TFs) and histones with epigenetic modifications.

paper_title: Analysing and interpreting DNA methylation data
notes: A genome-wide sequencing method for DNA methylation quantification.

paper_title: Reduced representation bisulfite sequencing for comparative high-resolution DNA methylation analysis
notes: A restricted method for sequencing methylated DNA in high-CpG genomic DNA; a variation of bisulfite sequencing that costs less than the whole-genome bisulfite sequencing.

paper_title: A Bayesian deconvolution strategy for immunoprecipitation-based DNA methylome analysis, Conserved role of intragenic DNA methylation in regulating alternative promoters
notes: An antibody-based method for pulling down and sequencing methylated DNA; can reach 100-300 base pair resolution.

paper_title: Whole-genome DNA methylation profiling using MethylCap-seq
notes: A sequencing method based on capturing methylated DNA using the MBD domain of MeCP2; uses a salt gradient to get DNA with different methylated CpG densities.

paper_title: Distinct DNA methylation patterns characterize differentiated human embryonic stem cells and developing human fetal liver.
notes: Uses methyl-sensitive restriction enzymes.

paper_title: Conserved role of intragenic DNA methylation in regulating alternative promoters.
notes: Unlike bisulfite sequencing, this method interogates unmethylated CpG sites; can reach single CpG site resolution.

paper_title: Oxidative bisulfite sequencing of 5-methylcytosine and 5-hydroxymethylcytosine.
notes: A method for discriminating between 5mC and 5hmC.

paper_title: Targeted and genome-scale strategies reveal gene-body methylation signatures in human cells.
notes: A method that first treats DNA with bisulfite, and then isolates selected locations for methylation profiling; uses designed probes of length ~100bp.

paper_title: Base-Resolution Analysis of 5-Hydroxymethylcytosine in the Mammalian Genome
notes: A sequencing method for mapping the locations of 5hmC in the genome.

paper_title: Ultra-low-input, tagmentation-based whole-genome bisulfite sequencing
notes: A DNA methylation profiling method that needs only ~10 ng of input DNA,  which is  100-fold less than required by the conventional WGBS; also called t-WGBS (tagmentation based whole genome bisulfite sequencing).

seq_fullname_old: Bisulfite sequencing of chromatin immunoprecipitated DNA
paper_title: Bisulfite sequencing of chromatin immunoprecipitated DNA (BisChIP-seq) directly informs methylation status of histone-modified DNA.
notes: Detects DNA methylation mediated through histones by direct bisulfite sequencing of Polycomb H3K27me3-enriched DNA

paper_title: High-resolution mapping and characterization of open chromatin across the genome.
notes: A high-throughput sequencing method for mapping genome-wide open chromatin regions.

seq_fullname_old: Assay for Transposase-Accessible Chromatin with high throughput sequencing
paper_title: Transposition of native chromatin for fast and sensitive epigenomic profiling of open chromatin DNA-binding proteins and nucleosome position
notes: A method for mapping genome-wide open chromatin regions, requiring fewer cells than DNase-seq.

seq_fullname_old: Formaldehyde-Assisted Isolation of Regulatory Elements and sequencing
paper_title: A map of open chromatin in human pancreatic islets.
notes: Uses formaldehyde to crosslink protein-bound DNA, leaving protein-free DNA fragments for sequencing.

paper_title: NicE-seq: high resolution open chromatin profiling.
notes: Uses the DNA nicking enzyme Nt.CviPII to sequence open chromatin regions;  requires low cell counts.

paper_title: Mapping accessible chromatin regions using Sono-Seq
notes: An open chromatin mapping method that can be performed along with ChIP-seq; the DNA breakage pattern may be different from DNase-seq (see the original study).

paper_title: Multiplex single cell profiling of chromatin accessibility by combinatorial cellular indexing.
notes: Uses a combinatorial barcoding technique to mark open chromatin regions in single cells.

paper_title: Capturing chromosome conformation.
notes: A method for testing a "one-to-one" interaction between two genomic regions.

paper_title: Circular chromosome conformation capture (4C) uncovers extensive networks of epigenetically regulated intra- and interchromosomal interactions.
notes: A method for testing "one-to-many" interactions between a fixed genomic region of interest and a set of genomic regions.

paper_title: Chromosome Conformation Capture Carbon Copy (5C): a massively parallel solution for mapping interactions between genomic elements.
notes: A method for testing "many-to-many" interactions between a set of genomic regions and several genomic regions of interest.

paper_title: Comprehensive mapping of long-range interactions reveals folding principles of the human genome
notes: A high-throughput method for profiling "all-vs-all" genome-wide interactions between any pairs of genomic regions.

seq_fullname_old: Chromatin Interaction Analysis by Paired-End Tag Sequencing
paper_title: An oestrogen-receptor-alpha-bound human chromatin interactome.
notes: A method for profiling genome-wide interactions between a given protein and any genomic region.

paper_title: Mapping 3D genome architecture through in situ DNase Hi-C
notes: Similar to Hi-C, but can reach higher effective resolution (see the original study).

seq_fullname_old: ionizing radiation-induced spatially correlated cleavage of DNA with sequencing
paper_title: Variable chromatin structure revealed by in situspatially correlated DNA cleavage mapping
notes: Utilizes ionizing radiation to break DNA in interacting chomatin loci;  can obtain chromatin conformation structure at a 50-500 bp scale.

seq_fullname_old: MICROcoccal nuclease chromosome Conformation assay and sequencing
paper_title: Mapping Nucleosome Resolution Chromosome Folding in Yeast by Micro-C
notes: A sequencing method for nucleosome-resolution analysis of chromosome folding; micrococcal nuclease is used instead of restriction enzymes to fragment chromatin; reaches 1-200bp resolution.

paper_title: Massively multiplex single-cell Hi-C
notes: Uses a combinatorial cellular indexing technique to map chromatin interactions in a single cell.

paper_title: R-loop formation is a distinctive characteristic of unmethylated human CpG island promoters.
notes: Maps the genome-wide locations of DNA-RNA hybrids (R-loops).

paper_title: Epigenome characterization at single base-pair resolution
notes: Maps genome-wide nucleosome locations; utilizes micrococcal nuclease to cut DNA; known to have a GC-content bias.

paper_title: A base pair resolution map of nucleosome positions in yeast
notes: A method for mapping nucleosome dyads by introducing a site-specific chemical cleavage; can reach base-pair resolution of nucleosome locations; serine 47 is mutated to a cystein in histone H4.

paper_title: MPE-seq, a new method for the genome-wide analysis of chromatin structure.
notes: Utilizes MPE-Fe(II) to cleave chromatin with a minimal DNA sequence bias.

paper_title: Genome-wide mapping of nucleosome positioning and DNA methylation within individual DNA molecules
notes: Can measure nucleosome locations and DNA methylation status from the same set of DNA, using fewer than 1 million cells.

paper_title: Replication landscape of the human genome.
notes: A method for sequenceing purified Okazaki fragments at replication forks.

seq_fullname_old: genome-wide, unbiased identification of DSBs enabled by sequencing
paper_title: GUIDE-seq enables genome-wide profiling of off-target cleavage by CRISPR-Cas nucleases.
notes: A useful method for profiling CRISPR off-target events.

paper_title: Broad histone H3K4me3 domains in mouse oocytes modulate maternal-to-zygotic transition
notes: Uses a small mount of DNA to profile histone modifications; recovers 85% of ENCODE peaks using as few as 500 cells.

paper_title: RNA-Seq: a revolutionary tool for transcriptomics.
notes: A widely used sequencing method for quantifying gene-level or transcript-level expression.

seq_fullname: TrueSeq: an RNA and DNA library preparation kit
paper_title: TruSeq data sheet
notes: A library preparation kit that can be used for genomic DNA fragments, or double-stranded cDNA converted from RNA.

paper_title: Extensive transcriptional heterogeneity revealed by isoform profiling
notes: A method for sequencing isoforms by circularizing the two ends of transcripts.

paper_title: Nascent transcript sequencing visualizes transcription at nucleotide resolution.
notes: A method for sequencing the 3' ends of nascent transcripts associated with the RNA polymerase; uses an engineered RNAPII elongating complex from yeast.

seq_fullname_old: Cap analysis gene expression with sequencing
paper_title: 5' end-centered expression profiling using cap-analysis gene expression and next-generation sequencing.
notes: A sequencing method that tags the 5' end of mRNA to profile transcriptional start sites; useful for annotating cell type-specific promoter usage.

paper_title: Nascent RNA sequencing reveals widespread pausing and divergent initiation at human promoters.
notes: A method for sequencing newly synthesized RNA; has resolution of ~50bp.

paper_title: Precise maps of RNA polymerase reveal how promoters direct initiation and pausing.
notes: Maps genome-wide distribution of transcriptionally engaged Pol II at base pair resolution; utilizes the fact that Pol II accumulates immediately downstream of promoters.

seq_fullname_old: Chromatin Isolation by RNA Purification and sequencing
paper_title: Genomic maps of lincRNA occupancy reveal principles of RNA-chromatin interactions
notes: Maps interactions between non-coding RNA and chromatin; must design probes for specific lncRNAs.

paper_title: Topology of the human and mouse m6A RNA methylomes revealed by m6A-seq.
notes: Maps the m6A modification sites on RNA; also called MeRIPseq.

paper_title: Genome-wide identification of Polycomb-associated RNAs by RIP-seq
notes: A method for capturing RNA-protein complexes; the RNA version of ChIP-seq.

paper_title: HITS-CLIP: panoramic views of protein-RNA regulation in living cells.
notes: A method for producing a fine-resolution mapping of RBP binding sites; uses a different RNA-RBP cross-linking method compared to PAR-CLIP.

seq_fullname_old: photoactivatable ribonucleoside enhanced cross-linking and immunoprecipitation
paper_title: Transcriptome-wide identification of RNA-binding protein and microRNA target sites by PAR-CLIP.
notes: A method for mapping the binding sites of RBPs and microRNA-binding proteins.

paper_title: Genome-wide analysis in vivo of translation with nucleotide resolution using ribosome profiling.
notes: A method for profiling the locations of ribosomes on actively translated mRNAs; also called ribosome footprinting.

paper_title: Genome-wide mapping of RNA structure using nuclease digestion and high-throughput sequencing.
notes: A method for profiling RNA structure by utilizing enzymes that are specific to single-stranded or double-strand RNA.

seq_fullname_old: selective 2'-hydroxyl acylation analyzed by primer extension (SHAPE) with sequencing
paper_title: Multiplexed RNA structure characterization with selective 2'-hydroxyl acylation analyzed by primer extension sequencing (SHAPE-Seq).
notes: Uses the chemical "1M7" to map loops in folded RNA.

paper_title: In vivo genome-wide profiling of RNA secondary structure reveals novel regulatory features.
notes: Uses the chemical dimethyl sulphate (DMS) to measure the difference in base-pairing of RNA.

seq_fullname_old: single-cell RNA-seq with Droplets and sequencing
paper_title: Highly Parallel Genome-wide Expression Profiling of Individual Cells Using Nanoliter Droplets, Comprehensive single-cell transcriptional profiling of a multicellular organism, Exponential scaling of single-cell RNA-seq in the past decade,  Single cells are manually picked (Tang et al. 2009; 1 cell.), SMART-seq: using FACS sorting (Ramskold et al. 2012; 12 cells.), single cell RNA-seq using fluidigm system (Brennecke et al. 2013; 100 cells.), CytoSeq: depositing cells into picowells (Fan et al 2015; 15000 cells.), Drop-seq (Current method): loading cells in nano-droplets (Macoscko et al 2015; 44808 cells.), STRT-seq (Islam et al. 2011), CEL-seq (Hashimshony et al. 2012), MARS-seq (Jaitin et al. 2014), inDrop (Klein et al. 2015), DroNc-seq (Habib et al. 2017), Seq-Well (Gierahn et al. 2017), SPLiT-seq (Rosenberg et al. 2018)
notes: A single-cell technique for quickly profiling thousands of individual cells by separating them into nanoliter-sized aqueous droplets, associating a different barcode with each cell’s RNA, and sequencing them all together. See the paper references below for other scRNA-seq techniques.

paper_title: Comprehensive single-cell transcriptional profiling of a multicellular organism, Exponential scaling of single-cell RNA-seq in the past decade,  Single cells are manually picked (Tang et al. 2009; 1 cell.), SMART-seq: using FACS sorting (Ramskold et al. 2012; 12 cells.), single cell RNA-seq using fluidigm system (Brennecke et al. 2013; 100 cells.), CytoSeq: depositing cells into picowells (Fan et al 2015; 15000 cells.), Drop-seq: loading cells in nano-droplets (Macoscko et al 2015; 44808 cells.), STRT-seq (Islam et al. 2011), CEL-seq (Hashimshony et al. 2012), MARS-seq (Jaitin et al. 2014), inDrop (Klein et al. 2015), DroNc-seq (Habib et al. 2017), Seq-Well (Gierahn et al. 2017), SPLiT-seq (Rosenberg et al. 2018)
notes: The Chromium system can be used  for single cell RNA-seq, linked-reads sequencing, and other sequencing projects. The steps are similar to Drop-seq, but may have higher cell capture efficiency. See the paper references below for other scRNA-seq techniques.

seq_fullname: RNA-Sequencing with Switch Mechanism At the 5' End of RNA Templates and sequencing
seq_fullname_old: RNA-Sequencing with Switch Mechanism at the 5' End of RNA Templates and sequencing
paper_title: Full-length mRNA-Seq from single-cell levels of RNA and individual circulating tumor cells, Comprehensive single-cell transcriptional profiling of a multicellular organism, Exponential scaling of single-cell RNA-seq in the past decade,  Single cells are manually picked (Tang et al. 2009; 1 cell.), SMART-seq: using FACS sorting (Ramskold et al. 2012; 12 cells.), single cell RNA-seq using fluidigm system (Brennecke et al. 2013; 100 cells.), CytoSeq: depositing cells into picowells (Fan et al 2015; 15000 cells.), Drop-seq: loading cells in nano-droplets (Macoscko et al 2015; 44808 cells.), STRT-seq (Islam et al. 2011), CEL-seq (Hashimshony et al. 2012), MARS-seq (Jaitin et al. 2014), inDrop (Klein et al. 2015), DroNc-seq (Habib et al. 2017), Seq-Well (Gierahn et al. 2017), SPLiT-seq (Rosenberg et al. 2018)
notes: A robust mRNA-Seq protocol that is also applicable to single cell assays; designed to improve on mRNA coverage. The second version, Smart-seq2, provides improvements over Smart-seq. See the paper references below for other scRNA-seq techniques.

seq_fullname_old: Single-cell RNA-seq with Microwell and sequencing
paper_title: Mapping the Mouse Cell Atlas by Microwell-Seq, Comprehensive single-cell transcriptional profiling of a multicellular organism, Exponential scaling of single-cell RNA-seq in the past decade,  Single cells are manually picked (Tang et al. 2009; 1 cell.), SMART-seq: using FACS sorting (Ramskold et al. 2012; 12 cells.), single cell RNA-seq using fluidigm system (Brennecke et al. 2013; 100 cells.), CytoSeq: depositing cells into picowells (Fan et al 2015; 15000 cells.), Drop-seq: loading cells in nano-droplets (Macoscko et al 2015; 44808 cells.), STRT-seq (Islam et al. 2011), CEL-seq (Hashimshony et al. 2012), MARS-seq (Jaitin et al. 2014), inDrop (Klein et al. 2015), DroNc-seq (Habib et al. 2017), Seq-Well (Gierahn et al. 2017), SPLiT-seq (Rosenberg et al. 2018)
notes: A high-throughput and low-cost scRNA-seq platform using simple, inexpensive devices. See the paper references below for other scRNA-seq techniques.

paper_title: Comprehensive single-cell transcriptional profiling of a multicellular organism, Exponential scaling of single-cell RNA-seq in the past decade,  Single cells are manually picked (Tang et al. 2009; 1 cell.), SMART-seq: using FACS sorting (Ramskold et al. 2012; 12 cells.), single cell RNA-seq using fluidigm system (Brennecke et al. 2013; 100 cells.), CytoSeq: depositing cells into picowells (Fan et al 2015; 15000 cells.), Drop-seq: loading cells in nano-droplets (Macoscko et al 2015; 44808 cells.), STRT-seq (Islam et al. 2011), CEL-seq (Hashimshony et al. 2012), MARS-seq (Jaitin et al. 2014), inDrop (Klein et al. 2015), DroNc-seq (Habib et al. 2017), Seq-Well (Gierahn et al. 2017), SPLiT-seq (Rosenberg et al. 2018)
notes: Uses a two-stage barcoding technique to label RNA from individual cells. Besides sci-RNA-seq, there are other single-cell RNA-seq techniques. See the paper references below for other scRNA-seq techniques.
